name: NPR
text:
2020 has been a lot ‚Äî and Iceland is ready to help.

The tourist board has developed an app that lets you record a scream, pent up by the pandemic, then broadcasts it from speakers in the Icelandic wilderness.
https://t.co/W29K9fnYHX

name: NPR
text: The Toronto Blue Jays baseball team won't be playing in Toronto this regular season after the Canadian government rejected a plan for the team to host home games there, citing coronavirus concerns. https://t.co/XXyxNzVntv

name: NPR
text: Over a 24-hour period, the world saw nearly 260,000 new coronavirus cases ‚Äî a new record. https://t.co/tJJOU1PJaV

name: NPR
text: Even before the age of social distancing, composer and conductor Eric Whitacre had been leading an online chorus for a decade. Choir members say the connection they foster is more important than ever. https://t.co/cFuxuOA3It

name: NPR
text:
Facebook agreed to settle a class-action suit claiming it violated users' privacy by scanning faces in its "tag suggestion" feature.

The deal was expected to let Illinois users collect $150.

But the judge is demanding that Facebook pay much more.
https://t.co/RJwSoPofWf

name: NPR
text:
Maria Konnikova is a professional poker player. So, @waitwait invited her to play a game called "You've got to know when to hold 'em, know when to fold 'em" ‚Äî 3 questions about "The Gambler," Kenny Rogers.
https://t.co/YS606mwwBw

name: NPR
text:
The new HBO documentary "Showbiz Kids" gives current and former child actors ‚Äî from Evan Rachel Wood to the late Cameron Boyce  ‚Äî the chance to talk about abuse, money, work and finding your way as an adult.
https://t.co/PZZjiXC4z5

name: NPR
text:
A few months ago, @NPRLifeKit shared instructions on how to make a #quaranzine ‚Äî a mini-zine documenting life during the pandemic.

Here's a look at a few that you shared with us üëá
https://t.co/5xhwMj0Lc3

name: NPR
text:
Photographers around the world introduce us to the newborns of 2020. 

The parents share their hopes, dreams and fears ‚Äî offering a glimpse of what it's like to welcome a baby during a global pandemic.  
https://t.co/RfW3kVXPTO

name: NPR
text:
Romance novel characters often face outlandish obstacles ‚Äî pirates, spies, paranormal forces, secret plots. But this month's round-up of novels focuses on down-to-earth stories about balancing love and career.
https://t.co/cKbidZPK2D

name: NPR
text:
As a college student, even if you want to social distance, how do you do it?

Tressie McMillan Cottom, PhD, assoc. professor at UNC-Chapel Hill,  and @npritsbeenamin's Sam Sanders talk about the state of higher education in the pandemic. https://t.co/qggCqeU0qX https://t.co/FutZ1FsIhG

name: NPR
text:
Critically ill COVID-19 patients in hospitals with less than 50 ICU beds "had a more than threefold higher risk of death than patients admitted to larger hospitals," says the author of a nationwide study.

He spoke to @commonhealth about those findings: https://t.co/1Vj8YpByCL

name: NPR
text: The Trump administration is rejecting new DACA applications from young immigrants who have never signed up before ‚Äî despite the Supreme Court ruling that allowed the program to continue. https://t.co/Zalm9Dp8DR

name: NPR
text:
John Lewis' fighting spirit never waned ‚Äî even in the face of advanced pancreatic cancer and a global pandemic. In March 2020, he appeared at a reenactment of the bridge crossing in Selma.

"I'm not going to give up," he said. "I'm not going to give in." https://t.co/ITaOjImgxz

name: NPR
text:
So many of us do it: the long scroll through grim news on social media before bed. It's called "doomscrolling" ‚Äî and psychologists warn that it traps us in a "vicious cycle of negativity" that fuels our anxiety.

So, here are some tips on how to stop üëá
https://t.co/NEXmeTLArS

name: NPR
text:
1/ The killing of George Floyd and the Black Lives Matter protests have brought a new sense of urgency to conversations about race in America.
 
NPR spoke with five Black families about how they‚Äôre having ‚Äúthe talk‚Äù about racism with their children now. https://t.co/fXztZDcIRX

name: NPR
text: 2/ As Black parents, Derek and Barbara Ford knew they‚Äôd have to have "the talk" at some point with their two sons ‚Äî‚Ä¶ https://t.co/JFfmBjBphE

name: NPR
text:
3/ Chris and Eriade Williams decided to take their kids to participate in peaceful protests nearby.
 
When their da‚Ä¶ https://t.co/Kn65j3l5Iq

name: NPR
text: 4/ When Maryam Jernigan-Noesi and Mariano Noesi talk with their son Carter, 4, about racism, Mariano says a major g‚Ä¶ https://t.co/RVWuSYwslA

name: NPR
text: 5/ Dr. Rhea Roper Nedd and Wilton Nedd II try to balance realism and hope talking about racial justice with their s‚Ä¶ https://t.co/1tonT2U0fO

name: NPR
text: 6/ When talking to their kids, Albert and Quinetta Latham try not to only "preach doom and gloom ... our history is much, much richer than the misfortunes that we faced" ‚Äî adding that "we understand there's still greatness that courses through our veins." https://t.co/fXztZDcIRX https://t.co/T6vvFIVzLb

name: NPR
text:
President Trump downplayed the danger of the coronavirus, claiming in an interview that many cases are simply people who "have the sniffles."
 https://t.co/WX9bhhPxmF

name: NPR
text: A federal court has ordered the Trump administration to fully restore DACA to what it was before it was rescinded in September 2017 ‚Äî and begin accepting new, first-time applicants. https://t.co/NnaJhPLbnp

name: NPR
text: We deleted a previous tweet to clarify that this order is the latest development following reports that the adminis‚Ä¶ https://t.co/gcywPZxcH8

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration calls Portland a "city under siege." 

Protesters and journalists who frequent the demonstrations agree a siege is happening. 

But over 14 days, federal law enforcement has increasingly become the occupying force. (via @OPB) https://t.co/n4Zv9tVYbB

name: NPR
text: ICYMI: The Oregon Department of Justice is suing several federal agencies for civil rights abuses after @OPB reporting revealed that federal agents have detained protesters using unmarked vehicles, with little explanation of why. https://t.co/YeJkOzv2ba

name: NPR
text:
Other city leaders created task forces to deal with the pandemic‚Äôs racial disparities. D.C.'s mayor created a committee on reopening business.

It's just one example of D.C.'s slow and passive response ‚Äî especially for Black residents. (via @apmreports) https://t.co/iHLXDEqoZd

name: NPR
text:
Think of a six-letter word for something you might wear. Insert an "O" in the exact middle, and you'll get a phrase meaning "Not aware." 

If you know what it is, submit your answer using the form below ‚¨á
https://t.co/aTwtgLq7lP

name: NPR
text:
The coronavirus has killed at least 603,285 people worldwide as of Sunday. Nearly a quarter of those deaths are accounted for by the U.S.
https://t.co/SoBBLiyEyF
